article.headline: Coastal Carolina 93, Asbury 64
article.story: CONWAY, S.C. (AP) -- Joseph Harris posted his third consecutive double-double with 17 points and 11 rebounds to help Coastal Carolina beat Asbury 93-64 on Wednesday night. Coastal Carolina (2-2) scored the first eight points of the game on a layup by Moses Sonko and 3-pointers by Everage Richardson and Jack Leasure. The Chanticleers eventually built the lead to 17 at 37-20 with just over 5 minutes to play in the half. But the Eagles (5-5) trimmed the lead to 44-32 by halftime. Asbury cut the lead to 51-44 with 12:53 left in the game. With 9:26 remaining, Coastal Carolina went on a 22-4 run to put the game away. Coastal Carolina hit 52.1 percent of its shots from the floor, including a school-record 16 3-pointers on 31 attempts, 10 of them in the first half. Asbury was 46.4 percent from the field, but just 27.8 percent from the 3-point arc. Leasure led all scorers with 22 points, 18 of them on 3-pointers, while Joshua Mack hit a season-best 17 points for Coastal Carolina, including five triples. Derek Bland was the only Eagle in double figures with 21 points.
